verses.kjv: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
verses.ct: Peter and John were on their way to the temple for the afternoon prayer time, around 3 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple;
verses.ct: There was a man who had been unable to walk since birth. Every day people carried him and placed him at the temple gate known as the Beautiful Gate, so he could beg for money from those going into the temple.

verses.kjv: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
verses.ct: When he noticed Peter and John about to enter the temple, he asked them for money.

verses.kjv: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.
verses.ct: Peter looked straight at him, and so did John. Peter said, "Pay attention to us."

verses.kjv: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.
verses.ct: The man focused on them, hoping they would give him something.

verses.kjv: Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.
verses.ct: But Peter told him, "I don't have any silver or gold, but I'll give you what I do have: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk."

verses.kjv: And he took him by the right hand, and lifted him up: and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
verses.ct: Then Peter grabbed him by the right hand and pulled him up. Instantly the man's feet and ankles became strong.

verses.kjv: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.
verses.ct: He jumped to his feet, stood up, and started walking. He went into the temple with them, walking and leaping and praising God.

verses.kjv: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:
verses.ct: Everyone there saw him walking around and praising God.

verses.kjv: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple: and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
verses.ct: They recognized him as the same man who used to sit begging at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, and they were completely stunned and amazed at what had happened to him.

verses.kjv: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
verses.ct: While the healed man held on to Peter and John, all the people rushed over to them at the covered walkway called Solomon's Colonnade, absolutely astonished.

verses.kjv: And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?
verses.ct: When Peter saw the crowd gathering, he spoke to them: "People of Israel, why does this surprise you? Why are you staring at us as if we made this man walk by our own power or godliness?"

verses.kjv: The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let him go.
verses.ct: "The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob — the God of our ancestors — has glorified his Son Jesus. You handed him over and rejected him in front of Pilate, even though Pilate had decided to release him."

verses.kjv: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;
verses.ct: "You rejected the Holy and Righteous One and asked instead for a murderer to be set free."

verses.kjv: And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.
verses.ct: "You killed the source of life itself, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses to this."

verses.kjv: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
verses.ct: "It is through faith in the name of Jesus that this man was made strong — this man you see and recognize. The faith that comes through Jesus has given him this complete healing right here in front of all of you."

verses.kjv: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
verses.ct: "Now, brothers and sisters, I know that you acted out of ignorance, and so did your leaders."

verses.kjv: But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.
verses.ct: "But this is how God fulfilled what he had announced ahead of time through all his prophets — that Christ would suffer."

verses.kjv: Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord;
verses.ct: "So turn away from your sins and turn back to God, so that your sins may be wiped away and times of renewal may come from the presence of the Lord."

verses.kjv: And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:
verses.ct: "Then he will send Jesus, the Christ who was appointed for you."

verses.kjv: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.
verses.ct: "Heaven must keep him until the time comes for God to restore all things, just as he promised long ago through his holy prophets."

verses.kjv: For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.
verses.ct: "Moses said to our ancestors, 'The Lord your God will raise up a prophet for you from among your own people, just like me. You must listen to everything he tells you.'"

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.
verses.ct: "Everyone who refuses to listen to that prophet will be completely cut off from God's people."

verses.kjv: Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
verses.ct: "In fact, every prophet from Samuel onward — all who have spoken — also predicted these days."

verses.kjv: Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
verses.ct: "You are the descendants of the prophets and heirs of the covenant that God established with your ancestors when he told Abraham, 'Through your offspring, all the families of the earth will be blessed.'"

verses.kjv: Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.
verses.ct: "God raised up his Son Jesus and sent him to you first, to bless you by turning each of you away from your wicked ways."
